P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

not_P.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes not fall below 75 years before 2040?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is 75 years or more, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

para_P.title: Will the average life span at birth in the US for males and females drop below 75 years prior to 2040?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, the average life span at birth (combined for both genders) in the US is recorded as being less than 75 years, as reported by the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. A formal announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to settle the question.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040 (2) There is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this part of the question. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, as determined by NASA or equivalent data sources.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this part of the question. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, with data for resolution coming from NASA, if possible. Note that the last possible set of 5 years to satisfy this requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to ensure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 (2) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes will not fall below 75 years before 2040?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following conditions are met: (1) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, according to NASA data or an equivalent dataset. The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy this requirement would be 2095-2099, with the last possible resolution date around mid-2100. (2) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is 75 years or more, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this condition.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? (b) Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question. (b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, with data sourced from NASA, if possible.

Q_given_P.title: Given that US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. Then, will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by January 1, 2100? 

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880. Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040, and (2) there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve this part of the question. (2) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, as determined by NASA or another reliable dataset.

Q.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

P.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

not_P.title: Will there not be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is no armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries do not each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries do not each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

para_P.title: Is a global thermonuclear conflict expected by the year 2070?
para_P.body:
Criteria for Resolution
This query will be considered affirmative if an armed confrontation occurs prior to January 1, 2070, under the following circumstances:
At least three nations each set off a minimum of 10 nuclear weapons, each with a yield of at least 10 kilotons, outside their own borders.
At least two nations each set off a minimum of 50 nuclear weapons, each with a yield of at least 10 kilotons, outside their own borders.
These criteria are designed to exclude a two-nation regional nuclear engagement, such as between India and Pakistan, or Israel and a rival, or the UK and France, despite the catastrophic nature of such events.
As is the case with various questions that have a positive resolution condition which may hinder the awarding of points on Metaculus, forecasters are urged to make predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until the year 2070 regardless.

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) there will be a global thermonuclear war by 2070 and (b) there will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true: (a) Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or (b) Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory; and (2) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions do not occur.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070? (b) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions are met: (1) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true: (a) Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or (b) Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory. (2) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025, resulting in at least 250,000 deaths, and (2) There will be no global thermonuclear war by 2070, defined as no armed conflict involving the detonation of a specified number of nuclear devices?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. (2) There is no armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true: Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory. This question will resolve as No if either condition does not occur.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070? (b) Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following conditions are met:
1. There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
   - Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
   - Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

Q_given_P.title: Given there will be a global thermonuclear war by 2070, will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if there are credible reports indicating that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020, that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths before January 1, 2025. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur. 

For the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true: 
1. Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory. 
2. Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be a global thermonuclear war by 2070, and (2) there will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
   - Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
   - Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is no armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) the life expectancy at birth for both genders in the US drops below 75 years prior to 2040, or (b) a global nuclear war occurs by 2070?
para_P.body:
Criteria for Resolution
This inquiry will be deemed Yes if one of the following takes place:
(a) The average life expectancy at birth for both genders in the US goes below 75 years at any point from January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, based on data from the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official announcement from any of these organizations will suffice to resolve the question.
(b) An armed conflict occurs before January 1, 2070, under either of the following circumstances:
- Three nations each launch at least 10 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
- Two nations each launch at least 50 nuclear weapons with a minimum yield of 10 kilotons outside their own borders.
These stipulations are designed to exclude a two-nation regional nuclear conflict, such as one between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an opposing force, or the UK and France, although such a situation would still be catastrophic.
As with many questions that could have a positive resolution condition that might prevent points from being awarded on Metaculus, predictors are encouraged to make their predictions in good faith, as points will not be granted until the year 2070.

Q.title: Will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes in the event that before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Either US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040 or a global thermonuclear war occurs by 2070 (2) A major famine occurs in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(1) Either of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
(2) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040, (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070, or (c) a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
(c) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if none of these conditions occur.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025 (b) neither US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040 nor a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.
2. Neither of the following occurs:
   (a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations.
   (b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where neither of the following conditions are true:
   - Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
   - Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
This question will resolve as No if either of the conditions is not met.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040, (b) a global thermonuclear war by 2070, or (c) a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occurs:
(a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.
(b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
- Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
- Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
(c) Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if none of these conditions occur.

Q_given_P.title: Given that either US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040 or a global thermonuclear war occurs by 2070, will there be a major famine in North Korea before 2025?
Q_given_P.body: Suppose the following is true: Either US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040 according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations, or there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory. Then is it true that there will be a major famine in North Korea before 2025? The question will resolve as Yes if before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths. The question will resolve as No if this does not occur.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) either US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040 or a global thermonuclear war occurs by 2070, and (2) a major famine occurs in North Korea before 2025?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
1. Either of the following occurs:
   (a) US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) falls below 75 years at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations, or 
   (b) There is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory, or two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
2. Before January 1, 2025, credible reports indicate that North Korea has suffered from a famine beginning no earlier than January 1, 2020 that has likely resulted in at least 250,000 deaths.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

P.title: Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extra terrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

not_P.title: Will Europa not be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe before that date. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly on Europa before January 1, 2045, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.

para_P.title: Could Europa be the initial location where humanity identifies alien life, provided it is found prior to 2045?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will conclude positively if humanity uncovers credible proof of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so ahead of discovering extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. Should convincing evidence of alien life be found elsewhere before it is found on Europa, this question will be answered negatively. If no evidence of extraterrestrial life is discovered before 2045, this question will be declared Annulled.
Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) highly improbable to have originated from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transported from Earth through other non-human-engineered means.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with more than 5% oxygen before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (b) any exoplanet with more than 5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found on Europa before 2045, this question will be Annulled.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) An exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is detected before 2030 (2) Humanity does not discover convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life on Europa before 2045?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if: (1) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030 and (2) humanity does not discover convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or does so after detecting extraterrestrial life elsewhere in the universe. If an exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before 2030 and convincing evidence of life on Europa is found before 2045, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Will Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. (2) An exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given that humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and this discovery occurs before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. Resolution Criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this question will be Annulled. 

Now, given that P is true, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before January 1, 2030? Resolution Criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe (2) An exoplanet with >5% oxygen atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, and (b) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, the question will be Annulled.

Q.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

P.title: Will we find life on Mars by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

not_P.title: Will we not find life on Mars by 2050?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have not discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions.
If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No

para_P.title: Is it possible that we will discover life on Mars before 2050?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if leading, esteemed scientific institutions declare that unambiguous proof of either present or past life on Mars has been found, excluding any life that may have been transported from Earth to Mars through human missions.
If this does not occur by January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as No.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We find life on Mars by 2050 (2) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050? (b) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as No.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 (2) We do not find life on Mars by 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if: (1) any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030, and (2) prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have found no unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) We find life on Mars by 2050 (b) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following is true: (1) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. (2) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030. If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as No.

Q_given_P.title: Given that we find life on Mars by 2050, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions. Then, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030? 

Resolution criteria for P: This question will resolve as Yes if the above-mentioned announcement occurs before January 1, 2050. 
Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) we find life on Mars by 2050 and (b) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: 
1. Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
2. Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.
If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as No.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

P.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if either of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050?
not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as Yes. If extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will resolve as Yes. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following will happen: (a) Europa will be the initial location where humanity identifies extraterrestrial life, if such a discovery is made prior to 2045? (b) We will uncover evidence of life on Mars by the year 2050?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will be considered Yes if either of the following takes place:
(a) Humanity uncovers compelling proof of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so prior to finding extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the cosmos. If convincing evidence of extraterrestrial life is discovered elsewhere before it is found on Europa, this aspect will be marked as No. If no extraterrestrial life is identified before 2045, this aspect will be Annulled. Note: the extraterrestrial life must be (a) currently living and (b) unlikely to have originated from contamination by Earth spacecraft. This allows for the possibility of life that may have been transferred from Earth through other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Renowned and respected scientific institutions declare that humans have found clear evidence of current or historical life on Mars, independent of any life that was transported from Earth to Mars through human-designed missions, prior to January 1, 2050. If this does not occur before January 1, 2050, this aspect will be marked as No.

Q.title: Will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) either humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 or we find life on Mars by 2050, and (b) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Either of the following occurs:
    1. Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled.
    2. Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) An exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050? (c) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.
(c) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030 (b) neither of the following occurs: (i) Europa is the first place humanity discovers extraterrestrial life before 2045 (ii) we find life on Mars by 2050?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following are true:
1. Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.
2. Neither of the following occurs:
   (i) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as Yes. If extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will resolve as Yes.
   (ii) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as Yes.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Europa be the first place humanity will discover extraterrestrial life, if it is discovered before 2045? (b) We find life on Mars by 2050? (c) We detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occurs:
(a) Humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe. If extraterrestrial life is found convincingly elsewhere prior to on Europa, this part will resolve as No. If no extraterrestrial life is found before 2045, this part will be Annulled. Note: extraterrestrial life must be (a) living currently and (b) highly unlikely to be a result of contamination by Earth spacecraft. This leaves open the possibility of life transported from Earth via other non-human-engineered means.
(b) Prominent, highly respected scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. If this has not happened before January 1, 2050, this part will resolve as No.
(c) Any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

Q_given_P.title: Given that either (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or (b) we find life on Mars by 2050, will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: either (a) humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045 and does so before detecting extraterrestrial life anywhere else in the universe, or (b) prominent scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050. Then will we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen before January 1, 2030? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as Yes if either (a) or (b) occurs as stated above. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if any exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Either humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or we find life on Mars by 2050, and (b) we detect an exoplanet atmosphere with >5% oxygen atmosphere before 2030?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:
(a) Either humanity discovers convincing evidence of life on Europa before January 1, 2045, or prominent scientific organizations announce that humans have discovered unambiguous evidence of current or past life on Mars, independent of life that was carried from Earth to Mars via human-designed missions, before January 1, 2050.
(b) An exoplanet with >5% O2 atmosphere is found before January 1, 2030.
